instruction: The input is taken from a negotiation between two participants who take the role of campsite neighbors and negotiate for Food, Water, and Firewood packages, based on their individual preferences and requirements. Given an utterance and recent dialogue context containing past 3 utterances (wherever available), output Yes if the utterance contains the small-talk strategy, otherwise output No. small-talk is a cooperative negotiation strategy. It is used for discussing topics apart from the negotiation, in an attempt to build a rapport with the opponent. For example, discussing how the opponent is doing during the pandemic or sharing excitement for the camping trip.
input:
Context: 'I would love it if I could get 2 food...2 firewood and 1 water....🙂🙂🙂🙂🙂🙂🙂' 'okk i will give ' 'that sounds great....thanks so much..you're wonderful!!!🙂🙂🙂🙂'
Utterance: 'thank you have a nice day'

input:
Context: 'I'll let you take 3 food and 1 water, and I will take the rest.' 'That sounds not bad...! Though I need at least 1 more water additional to that' 'Okay, I will give you 3 food, 2 water, and I will take 1 water, 3 firewood'
Utterance: 'That makes a deal... Thank YOU...!!!! Happy camping!'

If you can part with extra food, here's what I'm proposing' 'Yes you can definitely have all the food. Maybe 2 firewoods and 2 waters for me?'

Utterance: 'We have a deal, enjoy the camping trip with the family, the best memories'

input:
Context: 'I agree. I am feeling generous and I did buy a new axe for this camping trip. So, I could stick to the prior agreement and just work a little harder to find some dry trees to chop.' 'I appreciate your generosity 🙂 I think that bringing your axe would be a great idea! Also be sure to pack warm clothes and extra blankets! I'm sure we will both be fine' 'You are welcome! 🙂 I am happy that we reached an agreement! Did you happen to see any dry looking trees on along your way?'
Utterance: 'I am also happy we reached an agreement so easily! You are a great partner for compromising! Honestly, I am not sure how to tell if the trees look dry but I would definitely help you go look for some. I will submit our original deal so we can get on with camping🙂🙂'

How do you feel about the water packages?'
Utterance: 'I am a water junkie day to day but the place I am camping as a stream and I'm taking my water filter system, so I could offer you extra water in this case.'

input:
Context: 'HI. I'd love to get 2 additional packs of firewood. The weather forecast was for much warmer weather here and I just didn't bring enough with me. I also left my additional sweatshirt at home. I'd be happy to give you one additional water and two of food.  🙂🙂' 'Well I had a really great day fishing today and I would like to have some extra firewood so I can cook all of this fish.  How about I take the 3 packages of firewood and you can keep 2 additional food packages in return.'
Utterance: 'You really did have a good day didn't you! Sounds like fun. How many fish can one person eat? If I don't have the extra firewood I'm going to be really cold tonight. ☹️'

input:

'Ok thats nice, I need food more because I didn't bring much and that a problem,  What do you think if I give you 2 wood and you give me 2 food?' '🙂 Well let me counter it, more beneficial to both of us, you will get 1 water, 2 food and 2 firewood as I can easily find firewood in the forest.  The water due to my dry mouth illness, I need the most ☹️'
Utterance: 'Oh yes excuse me, I got confused, if you need water for me it's okay to give you the water you need.'

input:
Context: 'That sounds good to me!  I heard where we are going it is going to be really cold the next couple of nights so we definitely need extra firewood.  We also have a pretty big group so extra food and water would come in handy too.  So how about I take 2 of the extra firewood, 1 extra water and 2 extra food?' 'Oh we have a substantial group as well, one of which is newly pregnant. Since we could find firewood ourselves, how about you take 2 firewood, 1 water, 1 food? ' 'We could really use that extra water and food, maybe you would be interested a little bit more firewood?  How about I take 1 firewood, 2 water, and 2 food?  I've got a big group of guys to feed.'
Utterance: 'I completely understand 🙂 However, my group won't really need the firewood much. We'd need the food more since we have some kids with us and the fathers are like lumberjacks haha. 2 firewood, 1 water, 1 food would work best'

How about we take 2 food, 2 water then just in case they can be satisfied with the extra water. In that case you get 1 food, 1 water and all firewood. '

What kind of activities do you plan to do? I'm planning to really tire my kid out and do a lot of hiking. My husband's also excited to practice "survival skills" and wants to do a lot of fishing and foraging too.'
Utterance: 'We will be going with my sons, we are going to be doing a lot of fishing if weather permits! Practicing survival skills sounds fun, and useful! How would you like to split the extra supplies?'
